content.description: The obvious chimney next to the fir tree, right/uphill from Split Decision. Climbs better than it looks, and is quite unique for the area. Awkward stemming gets you off the ground. Face holds mostly on the right supplement the leg action. Huge jugs at the top take you to the right onto a slopey ledge, from which you pull on a tree stump to the anchor. There appears to be a much harder extension above.There's a tree right next to the route covered in sticky sap. Make sure to avoid touching it
content.location: Right side of Jane's Buttress, in the obvious deep corner

content.description: Adding this to help with confusion about the route between Wedgie, and Four Kids.  If anyone can find route info, or climbs this and has a recommended grade, please edit the route page.  Sport route starts up a less than vertical moss covered face with some side pulls and edges. Slabs out toward the top.
content.location: Route lies directly to the right of the bolted 5.8 chimney climb, Wedgie.  Starts just to the left of, or on top of, a rock that leans agains the sap tree.

content.description: Easy climbing on flakes and jugs. The midway crux features small holds and thin feet on cool brown varnish. The finishing slab goes two different ways.
content.location: The front side of Jane's Buttress. Look for the chains 3/4 up the cliff.

content.description: Sweet arete climb above the Wedgie route.Start at the bottom of Janes chimney and climb Wedgie to the first set of anchors then continue on up the steep, awesome arete, using the arete edge , small crimps, and a couple cool big sloper pockets to another set of chain anchors just over the top. Ends with a cool mantle with great holds. One could also do a 4th class down climb from the top or rap off large pine tree.  Head for the big Madrone tree at the top of the chimney. Youll see the Wedgie anchors, and you can start from there.  A 60m rope will get you down to the bottom from the summit.
content.location: Sling Blade is a "second pitch" or extension of Wedgie, the 5.8 sport route in Jane's Chimney.  Once you've  clipped the chains of the Wedgie anchors, continue straight above for 3 bolts of steeper climbing.

content.description: Another excellent climb on Jane's. A crux down low at the second bolt and some other cruxy climbing leads to a ledge after the sixth bolt. Climb through the headwall on steep rock to the top of the cliff, near the top of Mirror Image.
content.protection: Bolts. You can back-clean or set a long draw on the fourth bolt to cut rope drag.
content.location: Between Split Decision and Lady in Red.

content.description: Climb some sandy and mossy rock to a ledge. Then fun climbing on steep rock leads to a crux slab below the anchor. Moss, tree sap, and pine needles may be present depending on the season.
content.location: Next route uphill from Charybdis. Just right of a small cave.

content.description: Ridiculously short but otherwise quality climb with fun movement and good rock. Pull yourself off the ground on some big sidepulls, do a few crux moves between the second and third bolt, then finish on bigger holds with bad feet. Most enjoyable as a free-snake toprope as making clips interrupts the flow. But you also have to lead it because otherwise it doesn't count. Just kidding... sorta.
content.protection: Three bolts. Chain anchor. 15m rope required. Stick clip the chains if you want to TR first.
content.location: Way up the hill on the right side of Jane's. Past Four Kids and Fat Lip. Starts near a big madrone tree.

content.description: Climb Split Decision to its last bolt. Follow a flake/ramp to the top of the cliff. Fairly straightforward with one move of 5.11 going for the last hold at the top of the cliff.
Climbs the arete on the left side of the buttress. Easy and sort of blocky climbing for the first part. Then comes a balancey crux on some camouflaged holds.
content.location: Farthest left of the downhill(SE)-facing climbs.

content.description: A few steep moves off the deck lead to low-angle easy climbing.
content.location: Farthest up the hill on the west facing side of Jane's Buttress.

content.description: One of several newer climbs on Jane's far right side. Climb direct to the first bolt (5.10) or traverse in from around the corner and pull onto the low-angle slab. From there it's all easier climbing on good holds and solid rock. This is becoming one of the more popular climbs at Rattlesnake for warming up and introducing newer climbers to the crag.
content.location: Furthest right of three bolted climbs that start from the nice built-up belay pad, just uphill from the main trail.

content.description: Maybe if you bring a stick-clip for the first bolt then it's not so bad. Otherwise, it's bouldery, awkward moves through crappy rock to a strenuous clip, and then easy forgettable moves to the anchor shared with Four Kids. Not recommended.
content.location: Around the corner from Four Kids, far right side of Jane's Buttress

climbs.name: Charybdis
climbs.fa: Prep: Bill Newcomb, F.A.: Jerry Messinger

content.description: This route starts with three bolts worth of easy climbing followed by three bolts that that get steeper and harder as you approach the crux at the last bolt.
content.location: Just uphill from 'Lady in Red'. The lowest (farthest right) of Jane's west-facing climbs.

content.description: Vertical start with very small edges. After the 4th clip the climbing eases to the anchor.  Chains hang from the overhung scoop but are reachable from the dish below.  Upper slab has the typical probability of moss and tree sap.
content.location: Second to last route when walking up between Jane's and the Dominator Wall.  One route downhill of Janeviore Shares a belay pad with Ringer, starts on the other side of the crack/cave, opposite side of the butters from Wedgie.

content.description: A rounded buttress that is about 85 feet at its tallest. Jane's Buttress has some good variety with routes from 5.8 to 5.12a.
